thread.title: Everyone emits a unique 'cloud' of microbes
thread.title_full: Everyone emits a unique 'cloud' of microbes

author: CBC News
title: Everyone emits a unique 'cloud' of microbes
text:
Audio Everyone emits a unique 'cloud' of microbes CBC News Posted: Sep 25, 2015 3:38 PM ET Last Updated: Sep 25, 2015 4:02 PM ET University of Oregon researchers found everyone is draped in their own cloud of millions of bacteria and other microbes. (CBC) Microbial auras 
Everyone is surrounded by their own personal microbial cloud. 
This airborne collection is full of bacteria, fungi and skin cells, and now a team of researchers from the University of Oregon is the first to characterize its significance . They found that you shed up to a million cells per hour into the air around you and that everyone's microbiome is unique. 
That uniqueness has inspired researchers to determine whether the microbial cloud can act as an airborne fingerprint in forensics. Just when you left no evidence behind, it's the bacteria that have your story to tell.
